actions.text: Referred to the Committee on Rules.

official_title: A resolution to provide procedural due process to individuals nominated by the President to be the principal officer of an Executive Department during consideration of such nominee by committees of the Senate.

summary.text: Amends rule XXXI of the Standing Rules of the Senate to entitle any individual nominated by the President to be the principal officer of an executive department to certain procedural due process rights during consideration of the nomination, including the right to cross examine and call witnesses with relevant evidence.

titles.title: A resolution to provide procedural due process to individuals nominated by the President to be the principal officer of an Executive Department during consideration of such nominee by committees of the Senate.
